query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Intra due cibi, distanti e moventi 2 d’un modo, prima si morria di fame, 3 che liber’ omo l’un recasse ai denti;
4 sì si starebbe un agno intra due brame 5 di fieri lupi, igualmente temendo; 6 sì si starebbe un cane intra due dame:
7 per che, s’i’ mi tacea, me non riprendo, 8 da li miei dubbi d’un modo sospinto, 9 poi ch’era necessario, né commendo.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Between two foods, distant and moving 2 in the same way, one would die of hunger first, 3 before a free man could bring one to his teeth;
4 so would one stand for a year between two cravings 5 of fierce wolves, fearing them equally; 6 so would a dog stand between two does:
7 because, if I kept silent, I would not blame myself, 8 driven in one direction by my doubts, 9 since it was necessary, nor do I praise myself.
**Cornish:**
1 Ynter dew gegin, pell ha mosowgh 2 yn un fordh, kyns, marow bys vyth nans, 3 kyns den vyth den vyth onan dhe’y dhens;
4 marow bys yn sevel bledhen ynter dew awes 5 a’n bleydh fersen, ow pova an dhew; 6 marow bys ky yn sevel ynter dew venen:
7 rag, gen vyth taves, vyth onan vyth arvewgh, 8 ow pos dhe’m dowts dhe un fordh, 9 awos bos reydh, vyth onan vyth arvewgh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Io mi tacea, ma ’l mio disir dipinto 11 m’era nel viso, e ’l dimandar con ello, 12 più caldo assai che per parlar distinto.
query.result:
**English:**
10 I kept silent, but my painted desire 11 was in my face, and the demand with it, 12 much hotter than distinct speech.
**Cornish:**
10 Vyth taves, mes ow’m dysyr lymmys 11 o’m yn vyth edhen, ha’n gowsel gans, 12 moy halla ges dhe gewsowgh kler.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Tu argomenti: “Se ’l buon voler dura, 20 la vïolenza altrui per qual ragione 21 di meritar mi scema la misura?”.
query.result:
**English:**
19 You argue: "If good will endures, 20 why does the violence of others 21 diminish the measure of my merit?".
**Cornish:**
19 Tys owth leverel: “Gen pys bos an vos da, 20 an feth dhe’n arall rag reson pyth yw 21 ow leha vyth mesur dhe werthasowgh?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Ancor di dubitar ti dà cagione 23 parer tornarsi l’anime a le stelle, 24 secondo la sentenza di Platone.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Another reason for your doubt 23 is the opinion that souls return to the stars, 24 according to Plato's judgment.
**Cornish:**
22 Arall reson rag dowtya tys yw 23 gul owth leverel bos an enevi 24 dhe dhiskwedhes dhe Platon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Queste son le question che nel tuo velle 26 pontano igualmente; e però pria 27 tratterò quella che più ha di felle.
query.result:
**English:**
25 These are the questions that in your will 26 prick equally; and therefore first 27 I will deal with the one that is most bitter.
**Cornish:**
25 An re’n an govynnow a’th vos 26 owth pons yn keth, ha rag henna kyns 27 vyth treylya an onan moyha feth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 D’i Serafin colui che più s’india, 29 Moïsè, Samuel, e quel Giovanni 30 che prender vuoli, io dico, non Maria,
31 non hanno in altro cielo i loro scanni 32 che questi spirti che mo t’appariro, 33 né hanno a l’esser lor più o meno anni;
34 ma tutti fanno bello il primo giro, 35 e differentemente han dolce vita 36 per sentir più e men l’etterno spiro.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Of the Seraphim, the one who most burns, 29 Moses, Samuel, and that John 30 whom you wish to take, I say, not Mary,
31 have their seats in no other heaven 32 than these spirits who now appeared to you, 33 nor do they have more or less years in their being;
34 but all of them make the first circle beautiful, 35 and they have a sweet life in different ways 36 for feeling more or less of the eternal breath.
**Cornish:**
28 A’n Serafin, an onan moyha tan, 29 Moyses, Samuel, ha henna Jan 30 a vynnyth kemerel, vyth leveraf, na Mari,
31 na’n eus yn nen nef arall aga sedhow 32 ages an sperys re’n owth aperis dhys, 33 na’n eus dhe aga boos moy po le bledhynnyow;
34 mes aga oll owth wra aga kynsa klowr, 35 ha aga boos aga bew an bys yn keth fordh 36 rag mernans moy po le an eneval sperys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Qui si mostraro, non perché sortita 38 sia questa spera lor, ma per far segno 39 de la celestïal c’ha men salita.
query.result:
**English:**
37 They showed themselves here, not because this sphere 38 is their allotted place, but to make a sign 39 of the celestial one that has less ascent.
**Cornish:**
37 Aga owth omdhiskwedhes ama, na rag 38 bos an spera ma owth gul merkya 39 a’n nef a’n eus moyha dhe skentel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Così parlar conviensi al vostro ingegno, 41 però che solo da sensato apprende 42 ciò che fa poscia d’intelletto degno.

query.result:
**English:**
43 For this reason Scripture condescends 44 to your faculty, and attributes feet and hands 45 to God and intends something else;
46 and Holy Church with human aspect 47 represents Gabriel and Michael to you, 48 and the other who made Tobit well again.
**Cornish:**
43 Rag an keth, an Skrytur a omdhiskyn 44 dhe'gas fakeltedh, traow ha dhorn 45 a omdhiskynna Dhew, mes ow a vyn 46 Ha'n Eglos Sans, gans dhodh denel 47 A omdhiskynna Gabriel ha Mygel 48 Ha'n aral a welas Tobia yn iach.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Quel che Timeo de l’anime argomenta 50 non è simile a ciò che qui si vede, 51 però che, come dice, par che senta.
query.result:
**English:**
49 What Timaeus argues about souls 50 is not similar to what is seen here, 51 but, as he says, it seems that he senses it.
**Cornish:**
49 An peth a lever Timaeus a-dro dhe'n eneow 50 nyns yw keth ha'n tra a weler yma, 51 mes, avel ytho ev, yth ev a-vynn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 S’elli intende tornare a queste ruote 59 l’onor de la influenza e ’l biasmo, forse 60 in alcun vero suo arco percuote.
query.result:
**English:**
58 If he means to return to these wheels 59 the honor of the influence and the blame, perhaps 60 in some true arc of his he strikes.
**Cornish:**
58 Mar ev a vyn bos dyllo dhe'n rodoma 59 an enor a'n fluens ha'n gabm, mos 60 yn nebes a'y wir vo gwaynya ev.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Questo principio, male inteso, torse 62 già tutto il mondo quasi, sì che Giove, 63 Mercurio e Marte a nominar trascorse.
query.result:
**English:**
61 This principle, misunderstood, twisted 62 almost the whole world once, so that Jupiter, 63 Mercury and Mars it named in passing.
**Cornish:**
61 An nessa nessa, drog vynys, a droes 62 an bys oll a-dro unnwaith, lemmyn bytte 63 Yow, Merkyur ha Mars dhe'n henwynna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 L’altra dubitazion che ti commove 65 ha men velen, però che sua malizia 66 non ti poria menar da me altrove.
query.result:
**English:**
64 The other doubt that moves you 65 has much poison, because its malice 66 could not lead you elsewhere from me.
**Cornish:**
64 An aral ammledh a'th commova 65 a wra gwenonek meur, rag y drogvenen 66 nyns galla bos aga dhe'm dhe'n aral le.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Parere ingiusta la nostra giustizia 68 ne li occhi d’i mortali, è argomento 69 di fede e non d’eretica nequizia.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Our justice seems unjust 68 in the eyes of mortals, it is an argument 69 of faith and not of heretical wickedness.
**Cornish:**
67 Bos gweles anken y'n justiys ni 68 yn golwg anverel, yw argumens 69 a fydh ha nyns yw drogneth eretek.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Ma perché puote vostro accorgimento 71 ben penetrare a questa veritate, 72 come disiri, ti farò contento.
query.result:
**English:**
70 But because your understanding can 71 well penetrate to this truth, 72 as you desire, I will make you content.
**Cornish:**
70 Mes rag yth alla bos aga dewdhek 71 tremena dhe'n wirvos ma, 72 avel a vynny, vythfya vyth kontent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Se vïolenza è quando quel che pate 74 nïente conferisce a quel che sforza, 75 non fuor quest’ alme per essa scusate:
76 ché volontà, se non vuol, non s’ammorza, 77 ma fa come natura face in foco, 78 se mille volte vïolenza il torza.
query.result:
**English:**
73 If violence is when that which suffers 74 contributes nothing to that which forces, 75 these souls were not excused by it:
76 because the will, if it does not want, is not quenched, 77 but does as nature does in fire, 78 if violence twists it a thousand times.
**Cornish:**
73 Mar yw treus pan yw an keth a wra'n poen 74 nyns yw owth dhe'n keth a wra'n gorrys, 75 nyns yw an eneowma skusys rag henna:
76 Rag an voledh, mar nyns yw owth, nyns yw marow, 77 mes ev a wra avel natur a wra yn tan, 78 mar yw treus a'y gwaynya mil gweyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Per che, s’ella si piega assai o poco, 80 segue la forza; e così queste fero 81 possendo rifuggir nel santo loco.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Because, if it bends a lot or a little, 80 it follows the force; and so these did 81 being able to take refuge in the holy place.
**Cornish:**
79 Rag, mar yw owth dhe'n plyga meur po byghan, 80 ev a sew an fors; ha hemma a wrug hemma 81 ow pos dhe'n skap dhe'n le unnys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Se fosse stato lor volere intero, 83 come tenne Lorenzo in su la grada, 84 e fece Muzio a la sua man severo,
85 così l’avria ripinte per la strada 86 ond’ eran tratte, come fuoro sciolte; 87 ma così salda voglia è troppo rada.
query.result:
**English:**
82 If their will had been whole, 83 as Lorenzo held them on the steps, 84 and Muzio acted severely towards his hand,
85 he would have pushed them back along the road 86 from which they had been dragged, as soon as they were released; 87 but such steadfast will is too rare.
**Cornish:**
82 Mar beu an voas oll an golon, 83 kepar ha'n dalghas Lowrens war an gres, 84 ha Muzio a wrug yn feth orth y dhelergh,
85 ev a'n beu gwaynyas war an fordh 86 dhyworth aga veu tenys, pan veu letthys; 87 mes hemma golon mar chad a'n yw mes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 E per queste parole, se ricolte 89 l’hai come dei, è l’argomento casso 90 che t’avria fatto noia ancor più volte.
query.result:
**English:**
88 And for these words, if you have received them 89 as you should, the argument is quashed 90 that would have troubled you even more times.
**Cornish:**
88 Ha rag an gerow ma, mar eus keffrys 89 aga dhemedhes, dell yw an argumens 90 a veu gwrys agas gwlaha moy troha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ma or ti s’attraversa un altro passo 92 dinanzi a li occhi, tal che per te stesso 93 non usciresti: pria saresti lasso.
query.result:
**English:**
91 But now another pass blocks your way 92 before your eyes, such that by yourself 93 you would not get through: you would first grow weary.
**Cornish:**
91 Mes nebes, treus yw fordh aral 92 ragodha'gas lagha, lemmyn orth agas honen 93 ny wodhfe kedhes: kyns aga vefe blonys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 A questo punto voglio che tu pense 107 che la forza al voler si mischia, e fanno 108 sì che scusar non si posson l’offense.
query.result:
**English:**
106 At this point I want you to consider 107 that force mixes with the will, and they make it so 108 that offences cannot be excused.
**Cornish:**
106 Orth an poynt ma, mynnas bos tas prederi 107 bos an nerth orth an golon a gemmesk, ha aga wra 108 lemmyn na allo bos escusa an offends.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Voglia assoluta non consente al danno; 110 ma consentevi in tanto in quanto teme, 111 se si ritrae, cadere in più affanno.
query.result:
**English:**
109 Absolute will does not consent to harm; 110 but it consents to it insofar as it fears, 111 if it draws back, falling into greater suffering.
**Cornish:**
109 Golon absolut na wra consenti orth an drok; 110 mes ytho a wra consenti orth y drok yn le, 111 mar ytho a withdro, aga kodha moy drok.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Però, quando Piccarda quello spreme, 113 de la voglia assoluta intende, e io 114 de l’altra; sì che ver diciamo insieme».
query.result:
**English:**
112 Therefore, when Piccarda speaks of that, 113 she means absolute will, and I 114 mean the other; so that we both speak the truth.
**Cornish:**
112 Rag hemma, pan wra Piccarda hemma spella, 113 ytho a wra prederi orth an golon absolut, ha my 114 orth an aral; lemmyn ny wra leverel gwir orth an keth».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Cotal fu l’ondeggiar del santo rio 116 ch’uscì del fonte ond’ ogne ver deriva; 117 tal puose in pace uno e altro disio.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Such was the rippling of the holy stream 116 that issued from the source from which every truth derives; 117 thus it brought peace to one desire and the other.
**Cornish:**
115 Hemma veu an wava orth an avon sans 116 a dheuth dhyworth an fenten dhyworth aga deriv oll wir; 117 hemma a wra pas ha unn ha'n aral disir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 «O amanza del primo amante, o diva», 119 diss’ io appresso, «il cui parlar m’inonda 120 e scalda sì, che più e più m’avviva,
121 non è l’affezion mia tanto profonda, 122 che basti a render voi grazia per grazia; 123 ma quei che vede e puote a ciò risponda.
query.result:
**English:**
118 "O beloved of the first lover, O goddess," 119 I said next, "whose speech floods me 120 and warms me so that it enlivens me more and more,
121 my affection is not so profound 122 that it suffices to render you grace for grace; 123 but may He who sees and can do so respond to that."
**Cornish:**
118 "O amanza orth an kynsa karer, o diva," 119 me a leveras wosa hemma, "agas leverel a'm gorra 120 ha'm gorra tomm, lemmyn ytho a'm gorra moy byw,
121 an affection vyth na wra mar dhon, 122 rag ytho a alla dhemedhys gras rag gras; 123 mes hemma a wra gweles ha alla gwra hemma a wra gorra."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Io veggio ben che già mai non si sazia 125 nostro intelletto, se ’l ver non lo illustra 126 di fuor dal qual nessun vero si spazia.
query.result:
**English:**
124 I see well that our intellect is never satisfied 125 unless the truth enlightens it 126 outside of which no truth extends.
**Cornish:**
124 Me a wel ow kewsys na vythsa byth 125 agan deall, mar nyns yw gwir a'n goleuwhe, 126 mes a-ves na vyth gwir a yllesta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Posasi in esso, come fera in lustra, 128 tosto che giunto l’ha; e giugner puollo: 129 se non, ciascun disio sarebbe frustra.
query.result:
**English:**
127 It rests in it, like a wild beast in its lair, 128 as soon as it has reached it; and it can reach it: 129 if not, every desire would be in vain.
**Cornish:**
127 Y’n trigva ynno, kepar mil en golen, 128 pub sodho dell yw kavos; ha kavos a yll: 129 mar nyns, pub dysyr a vydh frustrys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Nasce per quello, a guisa di rampollo, 131 a piè del vero il dubbio; ed è natura 132 ch’al sommo pinge noi di collo in collo.
query.result:
**English:**
130 Doubt is born from that, like a new shoot, 131 at the foot of truth; and it is nature’s way 132 that it spurs us on, from step to step, to the summit.
**Cornish:**
130 A-dhia drefenno, kepar pren nowydh, 131 war-lergh an wir, an ammeth; ha naturel yw 132 ow thaskorra ni dhe’n ughella, a gamm dhe gamm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Questo m’invita, questo m’assicura 134 con reverenza, donna, a dimandarvi 135 d’un’altra verità che m’è oscura.
query.result:
**English:**
133 This invites me, this assures me 134 with reverence, lady, to ask you 135 about another truth that is obscure to me.
**Cornish:**
133 Henn a’m gwel, henn a’m sygur, 134 gans reverens, benen, dhe govyn orth 135 gwirvos erel a’m tywyll.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Io vo’ saper se l’uom può sodisfarvi 137 ai voti manchi sì con altri beni, 138 ch’a la vostra statera non sien parvi».
query.result:
**English:**
136 I want to know if man can satisfy you 137 with other goods for the vows he has failed to keep, 138 which may not seem small on your scales.
**Cornish:**
136 Y’m eus karas ha’n gallos den vy sodhfya 137 rag an mann a veu mank, gans bennow erel, 138 na vydh byghan war aga skales.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Beatrice mi guardò con li occhi pieni 140 di faville d’amor così divini, 141 che, vinta, mia virtute diè le reni,
142 e quasi mi perdei con li occhi chini.
query.result:
**English:**
139 Beatrice looked at me with her eyes full 140 of such divine sparks of love 141 that, vanquished, my strength gave way,
142 and I almost lost myself, my eyes downcast.
**Cornish:**
139 Beatrice a’m sellas gans he dhewlagow 140 leun a garow karantek, 141 pubma, ow kovyth, a roos y’m nerth,
142 ha bron dhe bron a gollav gans y’m dewlagow isel.
